Just a heads up for everyone: office hours are going to end at 4:00 instead of 5:00 today -- due to AMS, I'm the only one available to answer questions and I need to leave at 4
Dan Marsh and I showed up today (June 15 2022) for ESDS office hours. I guess this session was cancelled due to CESM Workshop?
No. I think our usual attendees were sick. Sorry for the lack of notice.

@Stephen Yeager if you have some questions, I'm happy to meet and chat about them. I'm in the office today, so we can talk in person if you're coming in or we can hop on zoom if you'll be remote. My calendar is up-to-date, though I may add a 30 minute meeting at some point today (@Daniel Marsh -- same offer to meet via zoom, just let me know)
Sorry no office hours today!
We are moving forward on a calendar scheduling option (baring UCAR legal security measures) that will deal with understaffing problems moving forward.

Office hours are now using an appointment scheduling system instead of being at a set block of time - https://ncar.github.io/esds/office-hours/

I just sent out an email about this with more information. I am very excited for the increased flexibility this provides for scientists and software engineers.

Screen-Shot-2023-06-28-at-9.06.29-AM.png

Has anyone else seen this when trying to join the Meet link for Office Hours? I'm guessing it might be something I botched (first appointment) or that got messed up because it was rescheduled.

I did find a quick workaround for the time being so not urgent - just trying not to repeat.

So the office hours automatically made a calendar event with a Google meeting link, it should, yeah? I'm not sure if the link is the same or different if the event was rescheduled. Do you have two different links you can try?

Julia Kent said:

So the office hours automatically made a calendar event with a Google meeting link, it should, yeah? I'm not sure if the link is the same or different if the event was rescheduled. Do you have two different links you can try?

The rescheduled appointment through Acuity made a calendar event and there was a link in the description, but it gave this error.

I'll do a bit of testing when I get a chance. Sounds like maybe it was the rescheduling or just a fluke.
Okay let me know. I haven't encountered this before.
